title: DatePicker
description: Guide to using the DatePicker component in Podo UI

basicUsage.title: Basic Usage
basicUsage.description: DatePicker is a component for selecting date, time, or date+time. It supports instant (single) and period (range) modes.

types.title: Types
types.description: Three types are supported: date (date only), time (time only), datetime (date + time)

period.title: Period Selection
period.description: Set mode="period" to select a start and end date. Reset/Apply buttons are shown at the bottom.

props.title: Props
props.showActions: Show bottom buttons (default true for period mode)
props.disable: Unselectable date conditions (specific dates, ranges, or functions)
props.enable: Selectable date conditions (only specified dates are enabled)
props.format: Date/time display format (y: year, m: month, d: day, h: hour, i: minute)
props.initialCalendar: Initial calendar display month in period mode

format.title: Date Format
format.description: Use the format prop to specify the date/time display format. Combine y (year), m (month), d (day), h (hour), i (minute) to create your desired format.

initialCalendar.title: Initial Calendar Month
initialCalendar.description: In period mode, use initialCalendar prop to set the initial display month for left/right calendars. Use 'now' (current month), 'prevMonth' (previous month), 'nextMonth' (next month), or a Date object.

valueInterface.title: Value Interface
valueInterface.description: DatePickerValue manages date and time as separate fields. This allows independent binding and control of date and time values.
valueInterface.date: Start date (year, month, day). Stored as a Date object.
valueInterface.time: Start time (hour, minute). Object containing hour (0-23) and minute (0-59).
valueInterface.endDate: End date. Specifies the end date of the range in period mode.
valueInterface.endTime: End time. Specifies the end time of the range in period mode.

disabling.title: Disabling Dates
disabling.description: Use disable and enable props to restrict selectable dates. You can specify conditions using specific dates, date ranges, or functions.
disabling.dateRangeDesc: Make a range of dates unselectable
disabling.functionDesc: Dynamically disable dates with a condition function
disabling.enableOnlyDesc: Use enable to make only specified dates selectable

minMax.title: Min/Max Date
minMax.description: Use minDate and maxDate props to specify selectable date range. You can specify time as well using Date object or DateTimeLimit format.
minMax.dateOnlyDesc: Selectable from today to 30 days later

minuteStep.title: Minute Step
minuteStep.description: Use minuteStep prop to specify minute selection interval. Supports 1, 5, 10, 15, 30 minute intervals. Default is 1 minute.

cdn.title: CDN Usage (Vanilla JS)
cdn.description: Use DatePicker with pure JavaScript without React. Load the script and styles via jsDelivr CDN.
cdn.liveDemoDesc: Below are live examples of the Vanilla JS DatePicker:
cdn.jsDelivrNote: Automatically fetches the latest version from jsDelivr CDN.
cdn.localizationDesc: Customize texts using the texts option.
